resources.string: Allow related permissions for Bluetooth connection
In order to protect user privacy, Android 6.0 or later versions needs you to apply for location access when accessing the Unique Device Identifier.
The device will be restarted and connected automatically to your phone. Please keep the device near the phone.
It takes a few minutes to update the firmware.Please keep the device near your phone
The device will be restarted and connected automatically to your phone.Please keep the device near the phone.
Please go back to connect the device again and retry.
Please delete connected device before connect to others
Press and hold the button until the indicator lights up. If the light is not on, charge the device first and try again after 10 minutes.
1.Please press and hold the power button for 4 seconds. The paired device will have a blue flashing light.
2.Make sure the device is near your phone. If there are other Bluetooth smart devices around, please put them away.
3.Check the Bluetooth status in the system settings to make sure Bluetooth is turned on.
4.If Bluetooth is already on, turn it off and on.
5.After above operations are done, return to search for the device.
After clicking, the indicator of the connected device will flash 2 times
